message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms and tenderness to palpation over the temporal artery suggest a diagnosis of giant cell arteritis, which can lead to inflammation and occlusion of the ophthalmic artery, causing blindness if left untreated. Renal failure, pulmonary fibrosis, and cognitive impairment are not associated with giant cell arteritis.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient's symptoms and physical exam findings suggest temporal arteritis, which can lead to blindness if left untreated. Renal failure, pulmonary fibrosis, and cognitive impairment are not typically associated with temporal arteritis.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms and tenderness in the right temporal artery suggest giant cell arteritis (GCA), which can cause blindness if left untreated. Renal failure and pulmonary fibrosis are not associated with GCA. Cognitive impairment can occur but is not a feared complication of GCA.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms and tenderness to palpation over the right temporal artery suggest temporal arteritis. Without prompt recognition and treatment, blindness is a feared complication of temporal arteritis. Renal failure, pulmonary fibrosis, and cognitive impairment are not typically associated with this condition.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms and the tenderness to palpation over his right temporal artery suggest temporal arteritis. Blindness is a potential complication if not recognized and treated promptly with corticosteroids. Renal failure and pulmonary fibrosis are not associated with temporal arteritis. Cognitive impairment may occur in later stages of the disease but is not a feared complication that prompt recognition and treatment can prevent.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms and physical exam findings suggest temporal arteritis, which can lead to blindness if left untreated. Renal failure and pulmonary fibrosis are not typically associated with this condition. Cognitive impairment may be associated with chronic inflammation, but is not a feared complication of temporal arteritis.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms and tenderness over the temporal artery suggest temporal arteritis, which can lead to vision loss if left untreated. Renal failure, pulmonary fibrosis, and cognitive impairment are not commonly associated with temporal arteritis.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms suggest temporal arteritis, which can cause blindness if left untreated. Renal failure, pulmonary fibrosis, and cognitive impairment are not associated with temporal arteritis.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms and tenderness over the right temporal artery suggest Giant cell arteritis. Blindness is a feared complication of this condition and prompt recognition and treatment with high-dose steroids can prevent this complication. Renal failure, pulmonary fibrosis, and cognitive impairment are not associated with Giant cell arteritis.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms and tenderness over the temporal artery suggest temporal arteritis, which can lead to permanent vision loss if not treated promptly. Renal failure, pulmonary fibrosis, and cognitive impairment are not associated with temporal arteritis.
